gurmukhi: ਗਾਵਤ ਗੀਤ ਸਭੈ ਗਨ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਸਭੋ ਮੁਖ ਬੇਦ ੳੁਚਾਰੇ || ਅਾਨੰਦ ਸਯਾਮ ਭਯੋ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਨਗ ਰੱਛਕ ਜੀਤ ਚਲੇ ਘਰ ਭਾਰੇ ||੧੭੪||
transliteration: Gadvat Geet Sabhai Gad Gaddhrab Brahm Sabho Moukh Bed Ouchdare|| Oonand Syaam Bhayo Man Mai Nag Rachchhak Jeet Chale Ghar Bhdare||174||
translation: The ganas and gandarvas began to sing songs and Brahma began to recite Vedas; there was happiness in the minds of all, and Krishna and his companions, the conquerors of the Naga, started for their home.174.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਕਢਯੋ ਸਿਰ ਕੇ ਮਗ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਨ ਕਢਯੋ ਮੁਖ ਕੇ ਮਗ ਜੋਰ ਅੜੀਕੇ || ਸ੍ਰੳੁਨ ਭਰਯੋ ੲਿਮ ਠਾਢਿ ਡਯੋ ਪਹਰੇ ਪਟ ਜਿੳੁ ਮੁਨਿ ਸ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਮੜੀਕੇ ||
transliteration: Kaahn Kadhyo Sir Ke Mag Hvai Na Kadhyo Moukh Ke Mag Jor Adeeke|| Sraoun Bdaryo Im Thaadh(i) Bhayo Pahre Pat Jio Mounndi) Ring Madeeke||
translation: Krishna came out from the head of the demon and not from his mouth, saturated with blood; all were standing like a sage clad in red ochre clothes;

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਕਹੀ ੲਿਹ ਕੀ ੳੁਪਮਾ ਫੁਨ ਅੳੁ ਕਬਿ ਕੇ ਮਨ ਮੱਧਿਬੜੀ ਕੇ || ਢੋਅਤਿ ੲੀਟ ਗੁਅਾਰ ਸਨੈ ਹਰਿ ਦੳੁਰ ਚੜੇ ਜਨ ਸੀਸ ਗੜੀਕੇ ||੧੭੫||
transliteration: Ek Kahieh Kioupmaa Phoun Au Kabi Ke Man Maddh(i)badike|| Dhoat(i) Eet Guaar Snai Har(i) Daur Chade Jan Sees Gadeeke||175||
translation: The poet has also given a simile for this spectacle; it seemed that the gopas had become red by carrying on heads the bricks and Krishna had run and stood on the top of the citadel.175.
End of “The killing of the demon Aghasura.”

gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਬਛਰੇ ਗ੍ਵਾਰ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਚੁਰੈਬੋ ਕਥਨੰ ||
transliteration: Ath Bachhre Gvaar Brahmaa Churaibo Kathnan||
translation: Now begins the description of the calves and gopas stolen by Brahma

gurmukhi: ਰਾਛਸ ਮਾਰ ਗੲੇ ਜਮਨਾ ਤਟ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਭੋ ਮਿਲਿ ਅੰਨ ਮੰਗਾਯੋ || ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਪ੍ਵਾਰ ਪਰਯੋ ਮੁਰਲੀਕਟ ਖੋਸ ਲੲੀ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Raachhas Maar Gad Jamnaa Tat Jaae Sabho Mil(i) Ann Manadyo|| Kaahn Pravaar Daryo Murleekat Khos Laiman Mai Soukh Paayo||
translation: After killing the demon, all went to the bank of Yamuna and put the articles of meal together; all the boys gathered around Krishna; putting his flute in his waist, Krishna felt great delight;

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਛਮਕਾ ਬਰਖੈ ਛਟਕਾ ਕਰ ਬਾਮ ਹੂੰ ਸੋ ਸਭ ਹੂੰ ਵਹ ਖਾਯੋ || ਮੀਠ ਲਗੈ ਤਿਹ ਕੀ ੳੁਪਮਾ ਕਰਕੈ ਗਤਿ ਕੈ ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਮੁਖ ਪਾਯੋ ||੧੭੬||
transliteration: Kai Chhamkaa Barkhai Chhatkaa Kar Baan Hoon So Sabh Hoon Vah Khaayo|| Meeth Lagad Tih Kioupmaa Karkai Gad(i) Kai Har(i) Ke Moukh Paayo||176||
translation: They immediately seasoned the food and began to eat it quickly with their left hand and put the tasty food in the mouth of Krishna.176.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੳੂ ਡਰੈ ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਮੁਖਿ ਗ੍ਰਾਸ ਠਗਾੲਿ ਕੋੳੂ ਅਪਣੇ ਮੁਖ ਡਾਰੇ || ਹੋੲਿ ਗੲੇ ਤਨ ਮੈ ਕਛੁ ਨਾਮਕ ਖੇਲ ਕਰੋ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਾਨਰ ਕਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Ko( i)  Darai Har(i) Ke Moukh(i) Graas Thagade Ko( i)  Apne Moukh Ddare|| Hoe Gad Tan Mai Kachhu Naamak Khel Daro San(i) Maanar Dare||
translation: Someone, being frightened, began to put the morsels in the mouth of Krishna and someone causing Krishna to eat the food, began to put the morsels in his own mouth; in this way all began to play with Krishna;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਛਿਨ ਲੈ ਬਛਰੇ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ੲਿਕਠੇ ਕਰਿ ਕੈ ਸੁ ਕੁਟੀ ਮਧਿ ਡਾਰੇ || ਢੂੰਢਿ ਫਿਰੈ ਨ ਲਹੈ ਸੁ ਕਰੈ ਬਛਰੇ ਅਰੁ ਗ੍ਵਾਰ ਨੲੇ ਕਰਤਾਰੇ ||੧੭੭||
transliteration: Taa Chhin Lai Bachhre Brahmaa Ikathe Kar(i) Su Koutimadh(i) Dare|| Dhoondh(i) Phirai Na Lahai Su Darai Bachhre Ar(u) Gvaar Nae Kartdare||177||
translation: At the same time, Brahma gathered together their calves and closed them in a cottage; all of them went in search of their calves, but when not any gopa and calf could be found the Lord (Krishna) created new calves and gopas.177.

gurmukhi: ਜਬੈ ਹਰੋ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ੲਿਹੈ ਤਬ ਹਰਿਜੀ ਤਤਕਾਲ || ਕਿਧੋ ਬਨਾੲੇ ਛਿਨਕ ਮੈ ਬਛਰੇ ਸੰਗਿ ਗੁਵਾਲ ||੧੭੮||
transliteration: Jabai Daro Brahmaa Ehai Tah Har(i)jitatkaal Kidho Banaae Chhinak Mai Bachhre San(i) Guvaal||178||
translation: When Brahma did all this stealing, then at the same instant Krishna created the calves alongwith gopas.178.
